intro: Hedysarum limitaneum, commonly known as the alpine vetch, is a perennial legume native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hedysarum limitaneum thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
